solution_line_template: He spent $7 on cereal because {num_cereal_boxes} x {cost_per_cereal_box} = <<{num_cereal_boxes}*{cost_per_cereal_box}={cost_cereal}>>{cost_cereal}
He spent $1 on bananas because {num_bananas} x {cost_per_banana} = <<{num_bananas}*{cost_per_banana}={cost_bananas}>>{cost_bananas}
He spent $2 on apples because {num_apples} x {cost_per_apple} = <<{num_apples}*{cost_per_apple}={cost_apples}>>{cost_apples}
He spent {cost_other_items} on everything but the cookies because {cost_milk} + {cost_cereal} + {cost_bananas} + {cost_apples} = {cost_other_items}

Each box of cookies is ${cost_per_cookie_box} because {cost_milk_per_gallon} x {cookie_cost_multiplier} = <<{cost_milk_per_gallon}*{cookie_cost_multiplier}={cost_per_cookie_box}>>{cost_per_cookie_box}
He bought {num_cookie_boxes} boxes of cookies because {cost_cookies} / {cost_per_cookie_box} = <<{cost_cookies}/{cost_per_cookie_box}={num_cookie_boxes}>>{num_cookie_boxes}
